Package message

Provides different message formats, the InputOutputHandler is capable of transmitting.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BasicMessage
    Interface any type of message the InputOutputHandler shall be capable of transmitting must implement.
    ExternalMessage
    Interface, all messages must implement, that involve a communication partner, that is no mix (e. g. a client or server).
    Reply
    Interface, all messages must implement, that travel in direction last mix −> first mix (= receiver −> client).
    Request
    Interface, all messages must implement, that travel in direction first mix −> last mix (= client −> receiver).
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Message
    Basic abstract class for all types of messages the InputOutputHandler is capable of transmitting.
    TestReply
    Generic test reply message.
    TestRequest
    Generic test request message.

Package message Description

Provides different message formats, the InputOutputHandler is capable of transmitting. Generally, there are two types of messages: ExternalMessages and InternalMessages (currently not implemented). All messages have to implement the interface BasicMessage which contains all basic message methods for the InputOutputHandler to transmit these messages successfully. External messages involve a communication partner, that is no mix (e. g. a client or server). In contrast, internal messages are only sent between the mixes of a cascade (e. g. to transmit control information between two components located on different mixes). Both types can be Requests or Replyies. Requests travel through the cascade from left to right (where "left" is the cascade's first mix, handling connections from clients and "right" is the cascade's last mix).

All messages extend the abstract class Message. Currently, only test messages are implemented:

  • TestRequest (ExternalMessage, Request): Used to request a new channel.
  • TestReply (ExternalMessage, Request): Used to transmit data on an existing channel.

An automatic padding mechanism is included, using the padding mechanism of component MessageProcessor.

See Also:
InputOutputHandlerInterface, Message
